uintMatrix.c

00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : uintMatrix.c                                                    *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Allocates memory for an unsigned int matrix of size ROWS x COLS.            *
00009 * INIT == 0  : malloc function is used for the allocation.                    *
00010 * INIT != 0  : calloc function is used, all elements are initialized to zero. *
00011 ******************************************************************************/
00012

00036 #include <stdio.h>
00037 #include <stdlib.h>
00038 
00039 void errorHandler(char errorText[]);
00040 
00041 unsigned int **uintMatrix(unsigned int ROWS, unsigned int COLS, unsigned int INIT)
00042 {
00043     unsigned int i;
00044     unsigned int **M;
00045     
00046     if(!INIT){
00047         if((M = (unsigned int **)malloc(ROWS*sizeof(unsigned int *))) == NULL)
00048             errorHandler("Error - In uintMatrix(): Can't allocate memory");
00049         for(i = 0; i < ROWS; i++)
00050             if((M[i] = (unsigned int *)malloc(COLS*sizeof(unsigned int))) == NULL)
00051                 errorHandler("Error - In uintMatrix(): Can't allocate memory");
00052     }
00053     else{
00054         if((M = (unsigned int **)calloc(ROWS,sizeof(unsigned int *))) == NULL)
00055             errorHandler("Error - In uintMatrix(): Can't allocate memory");
00056         for(i = 0; i < ROWS; i++)
00057             if((M[i] = (unsigned int *)calloc(COLS,sizeof(unsigned int))) == NULL)
00058                 errorHandler("Error - In uintMatrix(): Can't allocate memory");
00059     }
00060     
00061     return M;       
00062 }
